title: Understanding Systematic Errors
text: Systematic errors are consistent, repeatable errors associated with faulty equipment or flawed experimental design. They can skew results in a particular direction.

title: Identifying Causes of Systematic Errors
text: Consider the equipment and procedures used in the experiment. Are there any potential sources of error that could consistently affect the results?

title: Common Causes of Systematic Errors
text: Which of the following is a common cause of systematic errors in experiments?

title: Impact of Calibration on Systematic Errors
text: Calibration errors occur when instruments are not properly calibrated, leading to consistent deviations in measurements.

title: Distinguishing Systematic from Random Errors
text: Unlike random errors, which vary unpredictably, systematic errors are predictable and can often be corrected once identified.
